Box maxing class here  @rosewoodstudioschool in Perth, Ontario.  Day 4 and things are coming together nicely!! Applying solid edging and getting ready to cut the boxes open.  Picture 1 is a sample box, French walnut with sap that when waterfalled looks like lips! Satinwood inside with Holly edges. 

#rosewoodstudioschool #ferrazzuttibox #boxmaking #boxclass #veneeredboxes #woodworking #finewoodworking #perth #ontario #details

Haven’t done this in years, like 15!!! 24” Ulmia bench in Beech looks pretty snazzy with a refresh, flat is nice too.  Tail vice area is always a problem for being low, not sure if it’s possible to raise it,  otherwise that’s a lot of wood to plane down.  Really hated doing this job in the past but the @lienielsentoolworks low angle plane was a dream to use!! Probably re-sharpened it about 15 times. Getting through the grime really blunted the edge quickly. 

#workbench #ulmia #beech #handplane #rounddogs #notrough #tailvise #low #angle #woodworking #tenniselbow #crossgrain #oil #flat

Fresh run of squaring sticks are coming along. Excited about the brass and mother of pearl sets.  Various woods: Ipé, Snake, Ziricote , Ebony, Bicoté, Oak, Blood, Teak. 

#squaringsticks #square #freshbatch #dovetail #tools #wood #woodworking #woodworkingtools #custom #motherofpearl #checkforsquare #box #making #boxmaking #drawer #drawermaking

Fresh batch of squaring sticks getting close to being done.  Final fitting and some initials carving today. 

#squaringsticks #wood #woodworking #tools #collector #fancy #exoticwoods #measuringtools #boxmaking #drawermaking #checkforsquare #finewoodworking #outofsquare #cornertocorner #customtools

Fresh batch of Squaring Sticks are now available.  I re-sawed the rough blanks a year ago and they’ve been stickered for 8 months.  Lots of amazing woods, Ebony, Snakewood, Ipé, Ziricoté to name a few.  New this year are two sets with Mother of Pearl. 

Link to the new batch in my bio.

Happy New Years to all!!
 
#squaringsticks #woodtools #boxmaking #drawermaking #cabinetmaking #woodworking #tools #outofsqaure #tools #finewoodworking #custom #cornertocorner #customtools #slidingdovetail

Flipping through lifts of lumber is one of my favourite things to do.  Some might think it’s a waste of a day, just phone it in or how do you charge for it…  But for me, getting the best boards I can sets up the entire project for success and enjoyment.  Here’s some beautiful bubinga boards I pulled and 3 of the 4 are consecutive but were randomly positioned in the lift.  At 14 feet I’m glad I have shop mates to get them to the second floor, too big for the elevator. 

#woodrun #wood #blanks #customfurniture #woodworking #bubinga #bookmatch #thehunt #furniture #finefurniture #fordranger

No deep jaw clamp?? Here’s a clamping hack for that.  Edge jointing 5 foot veneers clamped between sprung boards but the middle still needs pressure to keep the veneers flat.  Some creative blocking and a clamp at the mid section works like a charm. 

#clamp #pressure #deep #jaw #throat #workaround #veener #edgejointing #wood #woodwork #nogaps #glue #or #veneertape #finewoodworking #cauls #Looks #PepetheKingPrawn #👍🏼

Miter joints typically need some form of extra mechanical joinery. This can be exposed like splines or keys or it can be hidden/blind.  Here I’m going with L Tenons, shop made 90° plywood floating tenons.  I’ve heard some people make these out of solid wood and make micro finger joints to form each L.  I’m using Baltic plywood and when they’re done they’re basically fingered jointed at the corner. These little things are unbelievably strong, unless you get the grain direction wrong.  One breaks with a bit of force but I’m using 5 Ls per corner, 20 in total.  I had a hard time breaking 5 of them.  It would be interesting to test the mortise strength… They are cut with a Domino machine and I’m surprised they don’t make L Dominoes by now. 

#L #tenon #Ltenons #ply #wood #joinery #littleL #woodworking #miter #nolog #oneatatime #cabinetmaking #furnitureandcabinetmaking #custom #cornerjoints #stresstest

I try to use plywood as much as possible for veneer core material but on large double doors I prefer the flatness of MDF.  The downside of this core material is it’s holding power or lack of, in regards to fasteners ie screws in this case.  With a little pre planning you can fortify the MDF with hardwood in the areas where screws will be located. You can inlay blocks, glue on an extra wide hardwood edge, drill for dowels into the edge then cap and veneer over.  Here I’m using the Domino tool to mortise into the edge however I only have the small machine and it will only go 28mm deep.  I want to fully submerge 8x40 dominos into the core then edge over them. The work around is to follow up each hole with this top bearing router bit to increase the depth of the mortises to 40+ mm.  If I had the Domino XL it could mortise 50mm I believe…and would make this operation really fast.  Maybe one day I’ll own one.  Anyway, the screws for the hinges now have something to bit into!! Word of caution, keep the MDF clamped with the router beams when gluing in the dominoes or you risk splitting the MDF.  Happy Hip Hinging!! 

#hiphinge #MDF #screw #fail #fortify #inlay #edge #veneerover #rocksolid #preplanning #extrastep #worthit #wood #doors #heavy #furniture #woodwork #woodworking #finefurniture #custom #hinge #flattire

So you want your 4 door quad book matched veneers to glue down without shifting? For crucial glue ups I don’t rely on blue tape.  These matched Ziricote & Bubinga veneers are trimmed 1/2” over sized so I can hot glue “Index blocking” directly to them.  I use a screw press to clamp my veneers and with that comes a higher potential for veneer shifting/skating than with a vacuum press but, a vacuum press can also be risky for precise veneer matching.  The blocking is MDF cut into 1/4” or so strips, sometimes I’ll use pine or something soft so it’s easy to flush later.  The cores on this case are MDF with bubinga edging that is about an 1/8” bigger all around so the doors get trimmed slightly along with the veneer after the pressing process. By cutting the veneer and the edging back slightly I find I don’t get any flakey bonds at the edge.  This seems to be more of an issue with a vacuum press though. 

#index #your #veneer #press #bookmatch #ziricote #customcabinets #doors #wood #woodworking #furnitureandcabinetmaking #indexcards #happyplanetindex #indexfunds #skating

Pressing Ziricote veneer from @certainlywood.inc for a set of 4 quad-book matched doors with figured Bubinga from @exoticwoodsinc.  Ziricote is super oily and you need to de-oil it and use a tenacious adhesive like West System Epoxy.  I had to call friend @brianreidfurniture for advise on the usage of epoxy for veneering and thickening it seemed to be crucial. Bosc pear for scale. 

#ziricote #bubinga #veneer #bookmatch #wallcabinet #custom #furniture #doors #veneerpress #screwpress #sizing #finefurniture #making #oneoff #superdeluxe

Sometimes it’s easy to get stuck in the 4/4  8/4 kiln dried rut. Here we’re cutting up a Crab Apple trunk from the garden of @karinaksteele  I started bucking it up for firewood when I realized STOP!! this will be beautiful wood for doors or veneers in a students project next year.  As a side demonstration with the class @woodschoolmaine we went through the process of sawing and air drying local wood.  What I find interesting here is how we don’t need big specialty saws and machinery to do it on a workshop scale with small trees like fruit woods.  Safety is always paramount, logs roll, and by creating a simple yet sturdy carriage to hold the half log it is easy to slide across the bed and fence of the bandsaw.  Every slice we repositioned the log in the cradle and secured it with screws located far from the cutting area.  Hopefully we’ll have some lovely apple wood next year..

#crabapples #sawyer #flitch #boules #airdried #lumber #bookmatch #sawyourouwnlogs #resaw #sticker #yearperinch #wood #woodworking #sawmill #funituremaking

Getting my mind blown in Brazil!!! I’m absolutely honoured to be here for 3 weeks teaching @fernandobelchiormarcenariafina 
We’re spending the first week getting supplies and organizing for 2 back to back chair design classes.  No poplar here for mock ups, instead we’re using 20’ long eucalyptus!! 

#brazil #woodworkinginbrazil #cruzeiro #fernandobelchiormarcenariafina #chairdesign #chairclass #wood #woodwork #saopaulo

Tucked away in the mountains of Brazil is @morito.ebine  I had the honour of visiting his shop thanks to my host @fernandobelchiormarcenariafina 
Morito was kind enough to pause his class and give us a tour.  If you don’t know his work…you should!! 

1) Morito with is sample of  Brazilian woods!!! 
2) Fernando, myself & Morito
3) Stools by Morito
4) Low rocker with armrest! Really comfortable!! 
5) Carved bowls, very large. The workbench is a work of art and very large, picture is deceiving.
6) Wall of dedicated sanding blocks. 
7) Brazilian Cedar aka; Spanish Cedar. Used for student projects, hand cutting joinery projects. 
8) local woods air drying in the cool mountain air. 
9) Upstairs gallery full of beautiful work, many chairs. Morito says Wegner is an inspiration for his designs.
10) The workshop, surrounded by mountains and mist and blossoming apple trees! 

#moritoebine #brazilianfurniture #japanesewoodworking #furnituremaker #furnitureclasses #handmade #wood #woodwork #handplanes #surfacetreatment

Day 3 of 5, chair design @fernandobelchiormarcenariafina

Outstanding creativity level, no one is holding back. Bananas for scale!

#screenprinting

It’s nice to be back in the shop after 6 months away teaching.  Im doing a major overhaul of my space and dumping stuff I haven’t used in years.  Not this though, the N°5 Rocker.  I made this as an experimental design years ago based on the number 5 and how some numbers and letters make nice chair side views.  The poplar version was quite springing and side to side it really had a ton of movement.  This Ash and walnut version still has a spring in the seat but the side to side movement has been stiffened up with that lower rocker panel.  The idea of adding rails really killed the design so with some trial and error the walnut rocker seemed to work.  Anyway, back on the wall, not quite worthy of living in a crate. 

#rocker #rockingchair #rockerpanel #number5 #N°5 #chairdesign #formoverfunction #wood #woodworking #furnituredesign #furniture #prototype

Shop remodelling wrapped up this week. Being away for 6 months really let’s you see how closed in the shop has become. Day to day you don’t notice it.  Probably filled 3 dumpsters and counting and it feels so good to purged 20 years of accumulated crap.  I had a member move out and that left a 8’ x 32’ closet space that really wasn’t functional.  Removing half the wall and making it 8’ x 16’ has given us a nice place for sheet goods, lumber and dust collection.  My work space is now tucked around the corner which frees up a ton of space in the middle of the shop for more machines. 

#workshop #woodworking #purge #ifindoubtthrowitout #customfurniture #sharedshop #groupshop #wood #working

I’ve been looking at this bandsaw fence for 25 years wondering how I can make it adjustable for “drift”? Here’s part one of the fence modification.  Cut it apart, sand it flat, cut steel plate, have daughter @doraferrazzutti weld plate to it, cut old table saw angle iron to size, sand paint off, drill for weld nuts, back to the welding shop.  I learned on a saw with an adjustable fence, meaning you can angle it so it’s not parallel to the blade. Some like this feature, others like rotating the table, some like where the blade rides on the wheels. Drift ! Stand by for part 2. 

#drift #bandsaw #modified #wood #woodworking #finewoodworking #furniture #fence #blade #tracking #whatisdrift #woodworkingmachines

Part 2. Bandsaw fence modifications so it can be angled to accommodate for ‘drift’. For those unclear what this means, wood will track through a saw cut at a slight non parallel angle to the blade.  My bandsaws tendency is for wood to want to track around 5° to the right.  So now I can set my fence to 5° and not have to fight the wood coming off the fence or the blade deflecting in towards the fence. Anyone that has resawn veneer only to break through the wood on the inside half way into the cut knows all about this.  Anyway, an adjustable fence is one solution. Some prefer to enlarge the table mount holes and simply reposition the entire table. Huge thanks to @doraferrazzutti for the heavy lifting and artistry, welding all this and making the custom flower knob. 👍🏼👍🏼

#bandsaw #modified #fence #resaw #resawn #veneer #driftangle #youcandoit #wood #woodworking #custom #furniture #design #furnituremaking

Finding really nice pieces of wood to make planes is always exciting and actually quite difficult.  I spend a lot of time in wood stores really examining each billet.  I bought these pieces over a year ago. Black&white Ebony, Snakewood, Claro Walnut gun stock blank (at the graft with burl!!!) The bubinga plane didn’t glue up quite right so I’m abandoning it.  Notice anything different with the cross pin ?? 

#woodenplanes #woodplanes #handplanes #shootingplane #veneershooter #dreamy #luxury #wood #woodworking #tools #woodworkingtools

Anyone else like “power flattening”? This is something I’ve only seen Japanese plane makers do.  To get through all the pesky mill marks, pits and the dreaded warpage in a new iron, QUICKLY… I use a wood block for power.  This allows for a tremendous amount of force to be put into the iron on the stone and takes the pressure off the hands and fingers and concentrating having to hold the iron on its own.  It’s akin to using a cabinet scraper vs a card scraper.  I’ll flatten about 1” of the back on 1000 grit and then focus on the leading edge, say a 1/4” back from the front, polished on 4000 and 6000 grit stones. As the iron gets resharpen over time the back becomes more polished and more mirror like. 

#sharp #sharpening #planemaking  #flattening #powerflattening #mirrorlike #honed #norulertrick #flatisflat #saveyourfingerprints #wood #woodworkinghandtools #woodworking #flatirons

Test driving 2 fresh planes.  Claro Walnut and Black & White Ebony aka Pale Moon Ebony.  It’s really interesting to watch that leading hand on the follow through.  I would have never thought that’s what my hand does.  As I watch the motion I think it looks like I’m trying to keep things locked in and stable.  That late finger wrap is really interesting.  Maybe I’ve watched too many golf swing videos….? Anyway, I’m taking beefy shavings here.  I’m looking for full width full length spills to start. After this I’m looking to see how light a pass I can get.  This usual requires two things to occur . 1) re-honing the iron. 2) flattening the sole.  Actually there’s an outlier here, 3) maybe this is 1? Flattening the sharpening stones??? 

#woodenplanes #handplane #shootingplane #customtools #woodtools #toolcollector #wood #woodworking #finewoodworking

I was lucky to come across all this Japanese sharpening stuff at a school tool sale.  I’m not even sure what it all is but man it’s awesome to use.  It inspired me to finally make a dedicated sharpening area in the shop. The stone flattener does such a great job, it’s cast iron or steel and it looks like you can use compounds with it.  The real show stopper is the natural limestone chunk, it’s all rough and shiny with one flat face.  Not sure the grit but feels like 1000 or so. 

#sharpeningstones #naturalsharpeningstone #manzentostone #knifesharpening #planeirons #hoing #nicethings #tools #woodworking #wood #woodwork

No shop, no problem.. visiting my sweetheart @karinaksteele here in Maine and wanted to get some ideas down on paper but sketching was going nowhere.  Kitchen table and art supply store to the rescue!! I’m embarking on a series of new box designs and rather than experimenting with actual veneers I’m using construction paper and mirrors to aid in the creative process.  I find it best to get ideas out fast and spontaneous as opposed to slow and worked on.. The MDF has the box dimensions laid out, the top and 4 sides coming off of it.  I only need to create one quarter of the design and the mirrors then reflect it and allow me to see the entire box pattern.  For me this is the most enjoyable part of any project! 

#creativeprocess #design #mockitup #mockup #veneeredboxes #ferrazzuttibox #wood #woodworking #woodveneer #boxmaking #kitchentable #crafts

I’m currently creating paper mock ups for potential box designs and I’m finding it totally addicting!! Old fashion analog designing is something I grew up with and continue to enjoy.  Paper, scissors, a glue stick and some imagination are a recipe for total creative freedom.  These patterns and explorations of shapes happen fast and spontaneously.  The last one totally changed direction and that’s what I love about this process!! I don’t think I’d have nearly the same outcome if I were to use French curves or a compass, rulers or even modern tech like a laptop.  For me, I’m just not proficient enough digitally to design freely.  Maybe one day I will, as I keep dabbling with digital and the programs keep getting more intuitive. 

#creativeprocess #spontaneousdesign #creativefreedom
#norulers #nofrenchcurves #colorandcontrast #veneer #woodveneer #mockup #boxmaking #design #graphicdesign #wood #woodworking

I finally got around to editing this footage from the summer @woodschoolmaine .  Assistant Facilities Director,  Matt McLaughlin and I have been planning this project for two years.  As educators I think it’s vital that we keep making work, experimenting and expanding our skills and knowledge of the material we work with and the craft.  One of the huge perks here at CFC is the ability to do all those things in the off hours.  Matt and I really wanted to upgrade the outdoor facilities and we needed to steam bend a pair of 12 foot 8/4 x 6 inch ash U shapes.  We needed a strap but didn’t have one 6” x 16’ but we did have 4 straps 3” x 8’ and these handy strap couplers from @leevalleytools 
Our steam box was only 8’ so we had to make up an extension for it to make it 12’. As well, we added a third steamer to that section.  The air dried ash, 18%mc was steamed for 2 hours and then bent around a form left over from a students project that we modified.  This was a fantastic group experience as many people helped out, even other classes came over on lunch break to help and watch.  Huge thanks to our assistant @david.rothstein.woodworking for putting up with all our orders and demands! 

#steambending #horseshoes #ash #airdried #maine #woodschoolmaine #ringer #wood #woodworking #craft #experiment #learnnewthings #teameffort

Here’s a sweet unexpected matching set!  This was such a surprise to see!! @sauer_and_steiner 

#handplanes #woodenplanes #wood #woodworking #woodworkingtools #tools #luxury #collector #matchingset

Just got this sent to me, thanks @nickclark1965 😂😂😂. Now you got me digging through old video footage!! This is first year at the College of the Redwoods.  Looks like I’m making saw horses after 6 weeks of sharpening, planemaking, practice joinery and the dreaded “perfect board”. I remember being given really crappy wood for the saw horses, all cracked and funky grain and knots.  This taught us how to be really selective when laying out parts.  The nice wood came out after we learned how to not waste it. 

#krenov #woodworkingschool #wood #woodworking #husqvarna

Here’s a small sample of shots from Brazil this past summer or should I say winter.  @fernandobelchiormarcenariafina and @evelynrosemariegrossbelchior have built this amazing shop/ school / community in a small town between São Paulo and Rio in the mountains. Huge hugs from Canada Fernando! 
1) Love the old planer, helical head no dust collection. 
2) Fernando and me! My first request was to see a local grocery store.  Eggs not refrigerated if anyone is interested.  Fruit to die for!
3) birdseye view of Fernando’s shop/school. The central courtyard  and mountain views are amazing.
4) makita is big here! Just know if you’re plugging into 110 or 220 !! The receptacles are the same.
5) street view out front the gates of the shop. 
6) chair mock ups, part making in Eucalyptus (hard as rocks) 
7) amazing diner @jambogastrobar 
8) fresh sawn wood air drying in the sun 
9) flowering Ipé tree! One of several colours. 
10) a glimpse of the shop. Located in what once was the family’s dairy. 

#woodeorkinginbrazil #school #chairdesign #wood #tropicalwoods #winter #woodworking #chairclass #bighugs

Sylvia at 8 weeks and now at 1 year!  She grew longer, hahaha.  She’s a merl corgi I got last year. We tried recreating this shot from last year, the other day after she turned one. 🎂 we call her Smidge most the time 😂

#corgi #merl #shopdog #lowrider

Cutting up the remaining snake wood log.  It’s roughly a 10” diameter x 30” on length. Knowing how to make a first cut is anyone’s guess…. Basically I’m trying to work around the visible cracks but you never know what’s inside!! What really surprises me about this wood is how remarkably stable it is off the saw and months later, it just stays flat.  The biggest problem is cracking if you’re not patient or if your shop is too hot.  Shall I say, the figure is outstanding. Hope to get one shooting plane and a bunch of squaring sticks out of this chunk. 

#snakewood #resaw #log #billet #flitch #boule #snakepit #resawpit #amazingfigure #wood #woodworking #tools #poolcues #squaringsticks #luxury #superdeluxe

Happy New Year !! @karinaksteele and I on our yearly visit to the Belgium Nursery!  Some of these cactus were planted 40 years ago and they were 30 years old when planted!!! That math means 70 years old! 😳

#belgiumnursery #2024 #happynewyear #prickly #cactus #cactusroom #doseofgreenery #winterblahs

#squaringsticks #maine #mexicomaine #rarewoods #daytrip #classmates #wood #woodwork #woodworking #tools #toolmaking #square

New run of my squarring sticks is coming together.  Swipe to see some process shots.  Mother Nature is really amazing, the woods are Kingwood, Snakewood, Tulipwood, Black&whiteEbony, Ebony, Bocoté.  There’s a few sweet book matched sets and of course sets with brass stops.  Hope to have these photographed and on my site next week.
